summary: Updated connman packages fix security vulnerability
details:
In ConnMan through 1.41, remote attackers able to send HTTP requests to
the gweb component are able to exploit a heap-based buffer overflow in
received_data to execute code. (CVE-2022-32292)

In ConnMan through 1.41, a man-in-the-middle attack against a WISPR HTTP
query could be used to trigger a use-after-free in WISPR handling, leading
to crashes or code execution. (CVE-2022-32293)
